patient_info: Renal potassium wasting,Hypokalemia,Increased urinary potassium,Hypocalciuria,Metabolic alkalosis
golden_diagnosis: Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome,Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome,Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Bartter Syndrome
2. Liddle Syndrome
3. Gitelman Syndrome
4. Hyperaldosteronism (Primary or Secondary)
5. Amiloride-sensitive Sodium Channelopathy
6. Renal Tubular Acidosis (Type 4, if hypokalemia is prominent)
7. Cystic Fibrosis-related Diabetes Mellitus
8. Familial Hypokalemic Periodic Paralysis
9.糖原贮积症 (Glycogen Storage Disease) Type I (Von Gierke's Disease)
10. Mineralocorticoid Receptor Antagonist Overdose (e.g., Spironolactone) 

Each of these conditions can present with a combination of hypokalemia, increased urinary potassium, hypocalciuria, and metabolic alkalosis, although the clinical context and additional symptoms or signs would help to further refine the diagnosis.
